name: The St. James of Knysna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the courtyard suite which was huge - a massive lounge area, bigger bedroom & even bigger bathroom! Great views of the lagoon & we could step straight out onto the lawns to get to the jetty.
reviews.title: Superb colonial retreat on the shore of the Knysna lagoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar area is alos huge but feels cosy - big log fires in the colder evenings make a welcome change.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

likes.liked: — The view from the window and the breakfast

reviews.text: The restaurant is excellent - well worth trying despite the massive choice available in Knysna. Breakfast is also excellent. During dinner the staff lit a real fire in our room - a great touch to return to.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff who made us feel very welcome. Car washing overnight was a nice suprise also.
reviews.title: indescriptible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor we decided to pick this hotel for Knysna. Not a bad choice at all! Very great breakfast selection, nice staff. Great location also on the lake, but a bit out of town, so a car is needed if you want to go out for dinner. Absolutely nice rooms (and big, very big!) I gave it 4 stars as apposed to 5, because after reading all the wonderful reviews; the picture in my head up front was slightly different. It felt a bit "old fashioned", but that could have been because we were a bit out of season and the other guests seemed a bit older then we are (and the decoration is also not very modern) But anyway. Nothing wrong with this hotel.
reviews.title: Outstanding service in a wonderful property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was truly a wonderful experience. The St James is set in superbly manicured gardens on the Knysna lagoon and it is stunning! We stayed for 7 nights and although we had a very mixed bag of weather it didn't spoil our stay. Our room was spectacular and the size of an entire apartment with lovely comfy beds and all the amenities you could wish for. The staff could not have been more lovely. I was, unfortunately unwell, during the stay and they were so helpful and concerned, it was really reassuring. Steven is an excellent manager/host but to be honest we could not fault any of the staff at all. The food is of a very high quality (and plentiful) - we would definitely stay again if we made the trip to SA again.
reviews.title: Could not fault it!

reviews.text: Despite the unexpectedly poor weather (rain from 24th to 26th December), we had one really sunny day in which to enjoy this superb Hotel.
reviews.title: One Of The Best!

reviews.text: We managed to get the last two rooms for these dates, even though we booked months ahead. Naturally my husband and I took the suite, whilst our teenage sons were allocated the Garden Room. Price wise, ours was almost twice the cost of their room, and although it felt indulgent to stay in such luxury, the boys were hardly deprived as the Garden Room was spacious and to a very high standard.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is what made this place sooo special. The gardens were beautifully kept, and the views accross the lagoon were awesome. We spent very little time actually using the services of the Hotel as we had relatives living nearby, so we were out a lot and ate with them each evening. However, the interactions we had with the staff were always very positive - friendly with attention to detail. The breakfasts were lovely!
reviews.title: The St. James - Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We don't often go back to the same place, but if I am lucky enough to get back to Knysna I think we would make an exception on this occassion!
reviews.title: Lovely, great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Lady Anne Suite and it was huge (usually we can't afford a suite so having a lounge and double balcony was a very pleasant suprise). Very good value with Knysna rates a lot lower than other places on our trips its a good place to splash out and chill out.
reviews.title: Wow for the Lady Anne suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice touches were great - cleaning our hire car overnight, turndown while you were in the restaurant. even a uk adaptor in the room for us!
reviews.title: Atrocious standard of customer care from a hotel claiming to be 5 star

reviews.text: Clearly getting people to eat in the restaurant is important to them (evening food/service was fine although I preferred breakfast), so I would probably recommend they did promotions or inclusive "value" to encourage people to eat there.
reviews.title: A superb stay in St.James

likes.liked: — The entourage in and around this hotel

reviews.text: Barman was very chatty and we liked him. Also view of lagoon was really nice an peaceful.
reviews.title: what a way to start our holiday

likes.liked: — quality of rooms and superb service. Good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool didnt desperately appeal (but neither did most of the other pools). Stayed 4 nights manically going up and down the garden route but would have happily chilled out there for a week.
reviews.title: LOVED St. James!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in St James's in Knsya in March 2008, and had a terrific stay. It is located just outside of Knsyna. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable with TV, shower, bath. The rooms are very well serviced, the staff are lovely and the food is fantatstic!
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: If you have a car there is room for parking and they wash your car every morning. We found the concierage very helpful in giving us tips on where to go and what to do in Knysna and around.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I have stayed in.
One of the best Boutique Hotels we have stayed in
reviews.text: Looking forward to going back soon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for four nights in late February what a superb place. We had a wonderful suite facing the lagoon, it was breathtaking. Our own lounge with comfy settees and a dining table plus TV, a large bedroom with patio doors looking out to the lagoon plus another TV and a beautiful bathroom. This is the place to feel special, the staff, the ambience everything makes you feel pampered. You are a short car ride to the Knysna Quays with some super restaurants ( try the Drydock). Its also in an ideal location to visit the surrounding area eg; the forest, Brenton on Sea, Plattenberg Bay etc.
reviews.title: Excellent - Cannot Get Better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to feel spoilt this is the one.
reviews.title: Loved It!

aka: The St. James Of Knysna Hotel
